Detailed Description

This class implements the IEEE 802.15.4A Channel Model[1] in the MiXiM omnet++ modeling framework.

"IEEE 802.15.4a channel model - final report", 2005, Andreas F. Molisch, Kannan Balakrishnan, Dajana Cassioli, Chia-Chin Chong, Shahriar Emami, Andrew Fort, Johan Karedal, Juergen Kunisch, Hans Schantz, Ulrich Schuster, Kai Siwiak

Citation of the following publication is appreciated if you use the MiXiM UWB PHY model for a publication of your own. J. Rousselot, J.-D. Decotignie, An ultra-wideband impulse radio PHY layer model for network simulation. SIMULATION January 2011 vol. 87 no. 1-2 82-112.

For more information, see also:

[1] J. Rousselot, J.-D. Decotignie, An ultra-wideband impulse radio PHY layer model for network simulation. SIMULATION January 2011 vol. 87 no. 1-2 82-112. http://dx.doi.org/10.1177/0037549710377767 [2] J. Rousselot, Ultra Low Power Communication Protocols for UWB Impulse Radio Wireless Sensor Networks. EPFL Thesis 4720, 2010. http://infoscience.epfl.ch/record/147987 [3] A High-Precision Ultra Wideband Impulse Radio Physical Layer Model for Network Simulation, Jérôme Rousselot, Jean-Dominique Decotignie, Second International Omnet++ Workshop,Simu'TOOLS, Rome, 6 Mar 09. http://portal.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1537714

Member Function Documentation

void UWBIRIEEE802154APathlossModel::filterSignal ( AirFrame *  frame,
const Coord &  sendersPos,
const Coord &  receiverPos 
) [virtual]

Has to be overriden by every implementation.

Filters a specified AirFrame's Signal by adding an attenuation over time to the Signal.

Parameters:
frame The incomming frame.
sendersPos The position of the frame sender.
receiverPos The position of frame receiver.

Implements AnalogueModel.

00184 {
00185     Signal& signal = frame->getSignal();
00186     // We create a new "fake" txPower to add multipath taps
00187     // and then attenuation is applied to all pulses.
00188 
00189     // (1) Power Delay Profile realization
00190     using std::max;
00191 
00192     txPower    = signal.getTransmissionPower();
00193     newTxPower = new TimeMapping<Linear>(); //dynamic_cast<TimeMapping<Linear>*> (txPower->clone()); // create working copy
00194     pulsesIter = newTxPower->createIterator(); // create an iterator that we will use many times in addEchoes
00195     // generate number of clusters for this channel (channel coherence time > packet air time)
00196     L = max(1, poisson(cfg.Lmean));
00197     // Choose block shadowing
00198     S = powf(10.,(normal(0, cfg.sigma_s)/10.));
00199 
00200     // Loop on each value of the original mapping and generate multipath echoes
00201     ConstMappingIterator* iter = txPower->createConstIterator();
00202 
00203     while (iter->inRange()) {
00204         // generate echoes for each non zero value
00205         if (iter->getValue() != 0) {
00206           // give the pulse start position
00207             addEchoes(iter->getPosition().getTime() - IEEE802154A::mandatory_pulse/2);
00208         }
00209         if (!iter->hasNext()) {
00210             break;
00211         }
00212         iter->next();
00213     }
00214     delete iter;
00215     delete pulsesIter;
00216     signal.setTransmissionPower(newTxPower);
00217 
00218 
00219     // Total radiated power Prx at that distance  [W]
00220     //double attenuation = 0.5 * ntx * nrx * cfg.PL0 / pow(distance / d0, cfg.n);
00221     double attenuation = getPathloss(fc, BW);
00222     pathlosses.record(attenuation);
00223     // Power intensity I at that distance [W/m²]
00224     //attenuation = attenuation /(4*PI*pow(distance, cfg.n));
00225     // create mapping
00226     SimpleTimeConstMapping* attMapping = new SimpleTimeConstMapping(
00227         attenuation, signal.getReceptionStart(), signal.getReceptionEnd());
